title: Incident 001: Hardening the SSH Gateway
excerpt: A deep-dive into moving beyond defaults. Hello there fellow seeker, I’m Mwithiga and today I dived deep in hardening the SSH gateway.
content:
Hello there fellow seeker, I’m Mwithiga and today I dived deep in hardening the SSH gateway. Security isn't just about building walls; it's about making sure your doors have the right locks.

The Protocol: I moved the primary entry point from Port 22 to Port 2222, disabled root login, and enforced a 3-attempt lockout.

The Challenge: The biggest hurdle was the 'intent vs. configuration' gap — learning that a saved file in nano doesn't mean an active rule until verified by the radar (ss). The gateway is now verified and locked.
